results.question: How does a non-employee director receive his/her restricted stock unit award or option grant?
gold_answer: on the date of his or her initial appointment to the Board of Directors equal to the pro-rated amount of the annual grant
results.markdown_table_response: The CEO of a publicly traded corporation is appointed by the Board of Directors (including the Chairman of the Board) as the non-employee director to be the exclusive voting member of the Board of Directors. The non-employee director is appointed by the Board of Directors to serve as the voting member of the Board of Directors. The non-employee director has no voting power. The non-employee director is appointed by the Board of Directors and the Chairperson of the Board of Directors to serve as the voting member of the Board of Directors. The non-employee director’s voting power is limited to his/her voting rights. The non-employee director’s duties and powers are defined by the Corporation’s bylaws.
results.csv_string_response: A non-employee director appointed to the Board of Directors of a publicly traded company is eligible to receive a restricted stock unit award or option grant if and only if the non-employee director is appointed to the Board of Directors of the company at the time of the grant or unit award. The option grant or restricted stock unit award is generally issued to the recipient of the grant or unit award after the grant or unit award is granted to the non-employee director.
results.json_rows_response:
A non-employee director who is initially appointed after any annual meeting of stockholders will receive a restricted stock unit award or option grant on the date of his or her initial appointment to the Board of Directors equal to the pro-rated amount of the annual grant. The grant amount is subject to the provision in the annual grant agreement or option agreement for the grant date fair value of the grant and includes the amount of the grant at the time of grant execution and any pro-rated amount of the grant for the duration of the grant. No portion of an option automatically granted to a director is exercisable after the tenth anniversary after the date of option grant. Additionally, an option automatically granted to a director may be exercisable after the termination of the director’s services as described in the option agreement, generally ending three months after such termination.

results.question: What are the capital expenditures for Bell Media in 2018 and 2019?
results.markdown_table_response: In 2018, we invested $3 million in capital expenditures at Bell Wireless, a $5 million investment in capital expenditures at Bell Media and $1 million in capital expenditures at Capital Intensity Ratio. In 2019, we are investing $6 million in capital expenditures at Bell Wireless, a $5 million investment in capital expenditures at Bell Media and $1 million in capital expenditures at Capital Intensity Ratio.
results.csv_string_response: The following table summarizes the data and accompanying text for the year.
results.json_rows_response:
Capital expenditures totaled $3,988  million for the year, up $17 million over 2018. This corresponded to a capital intensity ratio of 16.6%, down 0.3 pts compared to last year. Capital spending in the year reflected the following:
• Greater capital investments in our wireless segment of $33 million in 2019, compared to 2018, as we advanced the build-out of our LTE-A network, continued to deploy wireless small-cells to expand capacity to support subscriber growth and increase network speeds, coverage and signal quality, as well as to expand data fibre backhaul in preparation for 5G technology
• A modest reduction in capital spending in our wireline segment of $10 million in 2019, compared to last year, as we continued to focus our investments on the ongoing deployment of FTTP to more homes and businesses, the roll-out of fixed WTTP to rural locations in Ontario and Québec, the connection of fibre Internet and TV services to more homes and businesses and the execution of business customer contracts
• Lower capital expenditures at Bell Media of $6 million in 2019, compared to 2018, mainly due to production equipment and IT upgrades in 2018
